text.p: Here are highlights from Polish newspapers this morning.
- Poland will list Global Depositary Receipts (GDR) on the London Stock Exchange (LSE) for a 26 percent stake in the KGHM copper combine.
- The size and scope of social insurance premiums excessively burden employers and block creating new jobs, the opposition centrist Union for Freedom (UW) said.
- Dyrup Polska, controlled by Denmark's S.Dyrup chemical concern, has opened a new paint plant in Lodz, central Poland.
The plant, which cost nine million zlotys to build, will initially produce 1.2 million litres of paint a year.
- The Huta Konin aluminium smelter will buy a 50 percent stake in the Huta Skawina aluminium plant in the next few months from the listed Impexmetal foreign trade firm.
- Polish Prime Minister Wlodzimierz Cimoszewicz has applied to the Consumer and Competition Protection Office (UOKK) to examine whether the country's refineries equally treat their customers.
- France's VHF will buy a strategic stake in the brokerage house of state-owned Bank Gospodarstwa Krajowego (BGK) but the bank will keep control over the brokerage.

- Over 73.3 percent of adult Poles buying alcohol choose clear quality vodkas, with Premium Vodka produced by Polmos Zielona Gora the market leader, a survey by the Indicator market research firm said.

- System 3000 computer system trader in Krakow is planning to apply for a bourse listing to the Polish Securities Commission (KPW) by the end of 1997 and list shares on the parallel market in the second quarter of next year, company president Jacek Kubrak said.
- The listed Rafako boiler maker will carry out modernisation contracts at the Laziska power plant and Bialystok power and heating plant worth 6.5 million zlotys.
